Europe pushes for Ukraine role in Trump-Putin talks
subhead: Talks between Vladimir Putin and Donald Trump on the war in Ukraine are set to take place in Alaska next Friday. Europe has insisted that Ukraine and European powers should be part of any deal to end the conflict.

headline: More and more Ethiopians are risking their lives at sea in attempts to reach Yemen
subhead: On August 3, at least 90 migrants died when their boat sank in the Gulf of Aden. All of them hailed from Ethiopia's Tigray region, which has been plagued by ongoing political instability after two years of civil war.

headline: 'Freakier Friday': Lindsay Lohan and Jamie Lee Curtis reunite in nostalgic sequel
subhead: 22 years after the original hit, the film uses the same formula and the same leads for a feel-good movie that offers no surprises.

headline: 'Platonic' creators Nick Stoller and Francesca Delbanco: 'Writing about our experiences is the only way we know how to write'
subhead: The screenwriting and directing couple looks back on the origins of the comedy streaming on Apple TV+ and discusses how the arrival of streaming platforms has changed the industry.

subhead: 'Why Do We Party?' (4/6). Collectives and artists are working to put festivities at the heart of their activism. It is a way to fight activist fatigue, attract young people to their causes and escape repression.

headline: In Israel, ultra-Orthodox Jews are opposing Netanyahu to avoid conscription
subhead: Several thousand men protested on Thursday, answering the call of rabbis advocating religious disobedience and rejecting military conscription. The prime minister's coalition is under strain.

headline: Ayn Rand's irresistible attraction to the dominance of the 'alpha male,' as embodied by Elon Musk
subhead: 'Musk Fictions' (6/6). Since 2024 and his opportunistic support for Donald Trump, American billionaire Elon Musk has increasingly cited the 20th-century novelist Ayn Rand, the apostle of rational selfishness and capitalism.
